title: Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink at upper edge (*check this*)
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d and 457e)
Watermark: scrollwork escutcheon with dove over triple mount. Above crown; below: "G A" (RB'45)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle. A variation of the scheme of -1522. The supports are fluted. Between the right ones stands an urn, below a festoon. A landscape with a volcano is shown in the semi-circle. View at an ovoidal colonnade, with a double row of Doric columns.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for ceiling decoration".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, red ink at upper edge (*check this*). Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1524.
